definition: to defer/to put off (until later)/to postpone
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]
deferred death sentence/abbr. to 死緩|死缓[si3 huan3]
pinyin: si3 xing2 huan3 qi1 zhi2 xing2

sentences.english: He was sentenced to death but was reprieved by the president.
sentences.chinese: 他被判處死刑但被總統下令緩期執行。

sentences.english: In view of the age of the accused the magistrate give him a suspend sentence.
sentences.chinese: 鑑於被告的年齡，治安法官給他緩期處刑。

sentences.english: Having taken the age of the accused into consideration, the court has decided to give him a suspended sentence.
sentences.chinese: 考慮到被告的年齡，法院決定給他緩期處刑。

sentences.english: Death sentences with a suspension of execution may be decided or approved by a higher People’s court.
sentences.chinese: 死刑緩期執行的，可以由高級人民法院判決或者覈准。
